drug.name: Mizolastine
drug.description: Mizolastine is under investigation in clinical trial NCT01928316 (A Bioequivalence Study of Domestic (Made in China) and Imported Mizolastine Tablets in Healthy Volunteers).

classification.description: This compound belongs to the class of organic compounds known as benzimidazoles. These are organic compounds containing a benzene ring fused to an imidazole ring (five member ring containing a nitrogen atom, 4 carbon atoms, and two double bonds).

drug-interaction.name: Ivabradine
drug-interaction.description: Ivabradine may increase the QTc-prolonging activities of Mizolastine.

drug-interaction.name: Benzylpenicilloyl polylysine
drug-interaction.description: Mizolastine may decrease effectiveness of Benzylpenicilloyl polylysine as a diagnostic agent.

drug-interaction.name: Betahistine
drug-interaction.description: The therapeutic efficacy of Betahistine can be decreased when used in combination with Mizolastine.

drug-interaction.description: The therapeutic efficacy of Hyaluronidase (ovine) can be decreased when used in combination with Mizolastine.

polypeptide.name: Cytochrome P450 2D6
polypeptide.specific-function: Responsible for the metabolism of many drugs and environmental chemicals that it oxidizes. It is involved in the metabolism of drugs such as antiarrhythmics, adrenoceptor antagonists, and tricyclic antidepressants.

go-classifier.description: oxidoreductase activity, acting on paired donors, with incorporation or reduction of molecular oxygen, reduced flavin or flavoprotein as one donor, and incorporation of one atom of oxygen
negative regulation of cellular organofluorine metabolic process
